greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of terms in row n of irregular table A175327. For n >= 1, a(n) = number of runs (of both 0's and 1's) in the binary representation of A175326(n).
comment: a(0) = 0 is the number of terms in the empty list.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 07 2010
